item.title: 一桩悬而未决的大案让音乐产业在流媒体欺诈问题上既团结又分裂
item.description:
音乐界仍在争论谁应负责打击虚假流媒体活动

。【原文：

The music world is still debating over who should be responsible for cracking down on bogus streaming activity

】

item.title: 葡萄牙称可能在 2025 年达到 2% 的国防开支目标
item.description: 葡萄牙总理路易斯-黑山（Luis Montenegro）表示，葡萄牙将努力在 2025 年实现国防开支占国内生产总值 2% 的目标，这比最初的目标提前了四年。【原文：Portugal will try to reach its defense spending target of 2% of gross domestic product in 2025, four years ahead of its initial goal, Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said.】

item.title: Peloton 首席执行官称无意出售公司
item.description: Peloton Interactive Inc.首席执行官彼得-斯特恩（Peter Stern）表示，在他努力扭亏为盈的同时，他无意出售该公司，并誓言将其保持为 "一家独立的公司"。【原文：Peloton Interactive Inc. Chief Executive Officer Peter Stern said he has no interest in selling the business while he works on a turnaround, vowing to keep it “a standalone company.”】

item.title: OpenAI 和 Benchmark 支持来自前 OpenAI 员工的新创公司
item.description:
由人工智能巨头前员工组成的初创企业侨民队伍日益壮大。【原文：

There’s a growing startup diaspora of former employees from the AI giant. 

】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，企业预计将转嫁50%的关税
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行的一项最新调查显示，企业预计将把大约一半的关税相关支出转嫁给仍在大流行病时期通胀飙升中挣扎的美国消费者。【原文：Business expect to pass through roughly half of tariff-related expenses to US consumers still reeling from the pandemic-era inflation surge, according to a new survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta.】

item.title: Accel 表示，价值超过 10 亿美元的科技初创企业中约有 20% 会失败
item.description: 风险投资公司 Accel Partners 的合伙人 Rich Wong 说，目前有 1000 多家科技独角兽公司，即由风险投资支持的价值 10 亿美元或以上的公司，但至少有五分之一可能会失败。【原文：There are more than 1,000 technology unicorns, meaning venture backed companies worth $1 billion or more, but at least 1 in 5 are likely to fail, Rich Wong, a partner at venture capital firm Accel Partners.】

item.title: 亚洲认为特朗普提出的国防开支占国内生产总值 5%的目标不切实际
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动印度洋-太平洋地区的盟国增加军费开支，以应对来自中国和朝鲜等国日益增长的威胁，但这一举措正遭遇财政限制和债券市场动荡的严峻现实。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s push for Indo-Pacific allies to ramp up military spending to counter growing threats from the likes of China and North Korea is running into the hard reality of fiscal limits and jittery bond markets.】

item.title: 苏里南新总统将继续推动石油经济繁荣发展
item.description: 苏里南将在通常复杂的选举过程后宣誓就职其首位女总统，分析人士称，投资者对这个新近石油资源丰富的国家的政府更迭没有什么好担心的。【原文：Suriname will swear in its first female president after an usually complicated electoral process, with analysts saying investors have little to fear from a change in government in the newly oil-rich nation.】

item.title: 亿万富翁伊什比亚就白袜未来控制权达成协议
item.description: 贾斯汀-伊什比亚（Justin Ishbia）已经达成协议，为这位私募股权亿万富翁控股芝加哥白袜队铺平了道路。【原文：Justin Ishbia has reached an agreement that could pave the way for the private equity billionaire to take a controlling stake in the Chicago White Sox.】

item.title: 优步考虑使用稳定币降低货币成本
item.description: 优步首席执行官达拉-科斯罗萨西（Dara Khosrowshahi）表示，优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. is in the “study phase” of using stablecoins as a way to transfer money globally, Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said.】

item.title: 特朗普发出停止令，加密货币之争升温
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）不断壮大的加密货币帝国中的竞争派系之间的紧张关系正在加剧，总统儿子们拥有的一家公司向其利润丰厚的 memecoin 背后的组织发出了一封终止信。【原文：Tensions between the competing factions of Donald Trump’s ever-growing crypto empire are ramping up, with a company owned in part by the president’s sons sending a cease-and-desist letter to the organization behind his lucrative memecoin.】

item.title: 毛里求斯计划临时增税以稳定公共财政
item.description: 毛里求斯将暂时提高对个人和企业的税收，并削减一些社会项目的开支，以增加收入，稳定公共财政。【原文：Mauritius will temporarily raise taxes on individuals and corporations and cut spending on some social programs to shore up revenue and stabilize public finances.】

item.title: 美联储哈克表示决策者需要等待更多的明确信息
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长帕特里克-哈克（Patrick Harker）表示，美国经济仍有韧性，在关税和其他政策对经济前景的影响更加明朗之前，官员们应保持观望态度。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker said the US economy remains resilient and officials should maintain a wait-and-see approach until there is more clarity about how tariffs and other policies will affect the outlook.】

item.title: 施密德称，鉴于关税存在巨大不确定性，美联储需要灵活性
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）表示，他和他的同事们在评估关税对经济的影响时需要保持灵活。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid said he and his colleagues will need to be nimble as they assess how tariffs will impact the economy.】

item.title: 萨默斯称特朗普计划带来的债务激增将削弱美国实力
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统标志性的税收和支出计划将加重美国的债务负担，最终将损害美国作为全球主要大国的地位。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said that President Donald Trump’s signature tax and spending plan will add to the US debt load in a way that will end up undermining the nation’s status as the preeminent global power.】

item.title: Anysphere 被誉为史上发展最快的初创企业，融资 9 亿美元
item.description: 人工智能热潮让一些小型初创企业迅速做大。但是据估计，没有一家公司能像 Anysphere Inc.【原文：The artificial intelligence rush has enabled some small startups to grow very big very quickly. But by some estimates, none have grown as fast as Anysphere Inc., maker of the popular AI coding assistant Cursor, which has surpassed $500 million in annualized revenue, the company said.】

item.title: 欧洲央行触底反弹后，拉加德为未来战斗做好准备
item.description: 克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）刚刚公布了欧元区的前景，这可能是欧元区最好的前景。【原文：Christine Lagarde just unveiled an outlook that may be as good it gets for the euro zone.】

item.title: 稳定币公司 Circle 首次公开募股定价高于区间，股价上涨三倍
item.description: Circle Internet Group 公司及其部分股东在首次公开募股中筹集了近 11 亿美元，由于需求旺盛，募股规模扩大了两倍，公司股价飙升高达 235%。【原文：Circle Internet Group Inc. shares surged as much as 235% after the company and some of its shareholders raised nearly $1.1 billion in an initial public offering that was upsized twice amid strong demand.】

item.title: 德国 N26 公司考虑新一轮融资，允许部分退出
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，德国数字银行N26正在考虑以较低的估值进行新一轮融资，这可能会让包括Coatue Management、Third Point和Dragoneer Investment在内的一些现有投资者收回部分投资。【原文：German digital bank N26 is considering a new funding round at a reduced valuation that could allow some of its existing investors including Coatue Management, Third Point and Dragoneer Investment to recoup part of their investment, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 中美谈判之际，"TACO "贸易为何吸引投资者？
item.description: 5 月 30 日，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普指责中国国家主席习近平打破贸易休战协议，使关税从 5 月初的极高点下降。投资者看到了墙上的字迹：关税将再次飙升，损害经济。股市下跌超过 1%。但就在同一天晚些时候，特朗普表示他将与习近平通话，乐观情绪和股票价格得以恢复。6 月 5 日，当通话最终成行时，S&P 500 指数再次短暂飙升。【原文：On May 30, US President Donald Trump accused his Chinese counterpart, President Xi Jinping, of breaking a trade truce that brought down tariffs from extreme highs in early May. Investors saw the writing on the wall: tariffs would spike again, hurting the economy. Stocks fell more than 1%. But later the same day, Trump said he’d have a conversation with Xi, and optimism – and stock prices – were restored. When the call finally happened on June 5, the S&P 500 Index again briefly surged.】

item.title: 企业 "灾难性 "前景减弱，加拿大利率维持不变
item.description: 企业认为最坏的关税情况不太可能成为现实，这有助于说服加拿大银行决策者本月保持观望。【原文：Businesses believing that the worst-case tariff scenarios were less likely to become reality helped convince Bank of Canada policymakers to stay on the sidelines this month.】

item.title: 随着人工智能光环的形成，微软创下自七月以来的首个纪录
item.description: 微软公司股价周四盘中创下新高，刷新了近一年来的历史新高，因为投资者越来越多地将这家软件巨头视为人工智能领域的大赢家。【原文：Microsoft Corp. shares rose to an intraday record on Thursday, taking out an all-time high that’s stood for nearly a year as investors increasingly see the software giant as a major winner with artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 如果通胀风险持续存在，美联储主席库格勒支持维持利率不变
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，与唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税有关的更大规模的价格上涨是可能的，如果通胀上行风险挥之不去，她支持保持利率稳定。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said larger price increases related to President Donald Trump’s tariffs are likely, and that she supports holding interest rates steady if upside risks to inflation linger.】

item.title: 西门子能源为德国 75 亿欧元救援计划划上句号
item.description: 西门子能源股份公司（Siemens Energy AG）在取代德国政府支持的 110 亿欧元（126 亿美元）救援计划后，将在近四年来首次派发股息。【原文：Siemens Energy AG is on course to pay a dividend for the first time in almost four years after replacing an €11 billion ($12.6 billion) rescue package backed by the German government.】

item.title: 卢特尼克敦促美国更严格地执行对华出口限制措施
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）呼吁加强美国出口管制的执行力度，以防止中国窃取可能支持中国在人工智能和航空等领域的野心的美国关键技术。【原文：Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick called for stepped up enforcement of US export controls to prevent China from stealing critical American technologies that could support Beijing’s ambitions n areas like artificial intelligence and aviation.】

item.title: 埃斯克里瓦称欧洲央行关注关税政策对经济的影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦（Jose Luis Escriva）表示，决策者正在仔细观察美国关税对欧元区经济的影响。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Jose Luis Escriva said policymakers are carefully watching the impact of US tariffs on the euro-area economy.】

item.title: 瑞士军备部长寻求在防务竞赛中与欧洲建立更紧密的关系
item.description: 瑞士最高级别的武器采购官员正在寻求与欧洲邻国更紧密的合作，因为全球对武器的需求激增，而瑞士本国的国防工业却举步维艰。【原文：Switzerland’s most senior arms procurement official is seeking closer collaboration with European neighbors, as global demand for weapons surges and the nation’s own defense industry falters.】

item.title: 比特币 ATM 运营商 CoinFlip 探讨出售事宜
item.description: 随着加密货币领域交易的升温，全球比特币自动取款机网络运营商 CoinFlip 正处于权衡出售的早期阶段。【原文：CoinFlip, an operator of a global network Bitcoin ATMs, is in the early stages of weighing a sale as dealmaking in the cryptocurrency space heats up, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 交易员评估内塔尼亚胡联盟困境，以色列资产上涨
item.description: 由于市场开始考虑到本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理的政府面临垮台的风险，以色列的债券和股票都出现了上涨。【原文：Israel’s bonds and stocks rose as markets began factoring in that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government was at risk of collapse, an outcome that some traders view as a positive for the economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员预计七月暂停，部分官员认为 2% 是终点
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲央行官员设想在 7 月份制定下一次政策时暂停降息行动。【原文：European Central Bank officials envisage a pause in their interest rate-cutting campaign when they next set policy in July, according to people familiar with the matter.】
